intro: Banisteriopsis rondoniensis, commonly known as the Rondoniensis balsa, is a tropical tree native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces woody fruits that contain seeds, which are dispersed by animals. It is often found in lowland and swampy areas, contributing to the biodiversity of its ecosystem. Due to its ecological importance, it is considered a valuable species for conservation efforts.
